channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 20 bags at the junction of Sussex Gardens and Edgware Road, 22nd November
item.description:
Possible missed collection as waste presented outside restaurant in heavy duty black bags. Enforced and this is all domestic waste. Request for Veolia to clear all waste.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 175a, Edgware Road, Paddington, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water running down Kingdon Road from no 2/Dene Mansions, 22nd November
item.description:
There is a burst pipe or a blocked drain at the top of Kingdon Road (Outside No 2 or Dene Mansions) and water is running down the roadway at the kerbside First noted Fri 21.11.25, evening
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dennington Park Road, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tabletop dumped on pavement, 22nd November
item.description:
This furniture has been on the pavement more than 10 days now. I've reported on 'lovecleanstreets' and on this site. It was marked as 'fixed' on Friday but it is still there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wansey Street, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More daily bin mess, 22nd November
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Westmount Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bike causing obstruction, 22nd November
item.description:
Has now been reported to council numerous times. Within a year the council has put two letters on it which get ripped off. Letters do not ask for bike to be moved or removed. This bike is a causing obstruction here and needs to be removed. Why has it been marked as issue solved when it hasn’t been.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Overhill Road, East Dulwich, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog fouling in the neighborhood, 22nd November
item.description:
Continuing dog fouling. I have requested dog mess bins to be fitted to lampposts in my street before but no action seen. It’s an easy win and low cost solution I’d say, please !
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Reighton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog poo x 2, 22nd November
item.description:
More dog poo - please can you put stencils all along Chestnut Drive. Dog poo in/by the tree pit outside number 4 and by the tree outside number 8 Chestnut drive.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chestnut Drive, Welling, Greater London

item.title: Homeless encampment in underpass, 22nd November
item.description:
Some people have set up temporary homes in the underpass. This article describes an approach which was successful in such a situation in Croydon, requiring coordination between police and the council. Https://news.croydon.gov.uk/joint-operation-tackles-homelessness-in-whitgift-underpass/

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perry Vale, Forest Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle since August 2025, 22nd November
item.description:
Abandoned vehicle since August 2025 blocking the pavement and access to the building, potentially a fire hazard and you do nothing!!! It is unsafe for the residents of the building. If you ignore the problem and there is a fire or explosion of this van Westminster Council will be liable for criminal negligence. Take action ASAP

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Elmfield Way, Kensal Town, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet
